eu.opends.canbus

Class CANClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • eu.opends.canbus.CANClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CANClient
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class represents the connector to the CAN-Interface. Steering, gas, brake and control instructions from the real car will be forwarded to the simulator; heading, geo coordinates and speed will be sent back to the CAN-Interface in order to display the position and speed on a in-car display. Furthermore trigger collisions can be sent to the CAN-Interface.
    Author:
    Rafael Math

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CANClient(Simulator sim)
      Creates a new TCP connection with the CAN-Interface at the given IP and port

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void requestStop()
      Requests the connection to close after the current loop
      void run()
      Listens for incoming CAN instructions (as XML), such as gas, brake, steering angle, reset and change view, which will be forwarded to the XML-parser
      void sendCarData()
      Sends car data to the CAN-Interface, such as heading, geo coordinates and speed.
      void sendDeviationData(float deviation)
      Sends the current deviation from the normative line to the CAN-Interface.
      void sendTriggerData(java.lang.String triggerID)
      Sends trigger reports to the CAN-Interface if the simulated car has hit a trigger.
      void setSteeringAngle(float steeringAngle)
      Sets the target steering angle as read from the CAN-Interface in order to synchronize with the current steering angle of the simulator.
      void suppressSteering()
      Sets "doSteering" to false in order to suppress the steering of the real car.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Listens for incoming CAN instructions (as XML), such as gas, brake, steering angle, reset and change view, which will be forwarded to the XML-parser
        Specified by:

      • sendCarData

        public void sendCarData()
        Sends car data to the CAN-Interface, such as heading, geo coordinates and speed.

      • sendTriggerData

        public void sendTriggerData(java.lang.String triggerID)
        Sends trigger reports to the CAN-Interface if the simulated car has hit a trigger.
        Parameters:
        triggerID - ID of the CAN-Trigger that will be sent to the CAN-Interface

      • sendDeviationData

        public void sendDeviationData(float deviation)
        Sends the current deviation from the normative line to the CAN-Interface.
        Parameters:
        deviation - Value representing the current deviation in meters from the normative line.

      • setSteeringAngle

        public void setSteeringAngle(float steeringAngle)
        Sets the target steering angle as read from the CAN-Interface in order to synchronize with the current steering angle of the simulator. Sets "doSteering" to true.
        Parameters:
        steeringAngle - Steering angle as read from the real car

      • suppressSteering

        public void suppressSteering()
        Sets "doSteering" to false in order to suppress the steering of the real car. E.g. if the keyboard steering has higher priority

      • requestStop

        public void requestStop()
        Requests the connection to close after the current loop
